data.title: Shoes, Shirt, No Service
data.text:
One of the poorest examples of service at a restaurant in a long time.
From the moment we walked in and the owner, rather than finish seating us, engaged with a larger group behind us, I was unimpressed. Then, the server took 15 minutes to acknowledge us and bring water. We told her we were under a time constraint when she took our order. Don't use large words, it must have confused her as a salad and a wrap took 45 minutes to arrive. It's a small place, the food was decent, the service was abysmal. All we got from the waitress was a lukewarm "sorry for the delay, would you like a to-go box?" when the food arrived. She passed out table at least a dozen times during our 45 minute wait and never looked at us or said a word. How this place is #10 of over 200 restaurants in Springfield is beyond me. Subway is next door, go there.2 stars because the food was ok rather than one star

owner_response.author: Nadim K, Owner at Nadim’s Downtown Mediterranean Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm sorry you had such a long wait, Ward. We do get quite busy sometimes and we try our best to get each meal our as quickly as possible, but I'm sorry we fell short on your recent visit. I also apologize if there was any miscommunication or less than attentive service on our part. We're lucky to have a great team here and although the kitchen was delayed in completing your order, does not mean that your server did not understand you. We have a bright and capable staff, and as with anything, there is always room for improvement. I regret that you left with a negative impression, but I appreciate your feedback.

All the best,
Chef Nadim
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Quality and service greatly improved
data.text:
I generally come here once or twice yearly, generally "before symphony". In the past it was merely convenience and the food was just good.  This visit the food was excellent and Crystal, our waitress (of 2 months employment) was exceptional. We arrived just before 6 pm and were done by 7:10.  

My wife and I shared appetizers of cauliflower seared scallops, which were done to perfection (not raw in the center, wonderfully spiced).  We then shared lamb kabob with grilled vegetables and a side of rice with caramelized onions and lentils between the two of us.  It was more then enough.   Great meal.  
10% discount by showing symphony ticket for night of performance... FYI.

owner_response.author: Nadim K, Owner at Nadim’s Downtown Mediterranean Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks so much for joining us for your recent symphony night. I'm thrilled you enjoyed everything from the service to the scallops! We're lucky to have a great team here and I'll be sure to pass your compliments to Crystal -- she'll be pleased to know you had such an enjoyable meal. We appreciate your support and look forward to seeing you again before your next concert.

All the best,
Chef Nadim

data.text: We went here because we had a coupon, but were very pleasantly surprised.  We chose to sit outside, found the waiter to be extremely helpful in describing the dishes. Our plates included a variety of selections including hummus, baba ganoush, mujadara, falafal, and Mediterranean Shrimp. The portions were generous and we had a lovely time. Look forward to returning in the future.

data.title: Delicious food with horrible service
data.text: The falafel and salmon on a plank were delicious, but that's where it ends.  We were told there was a hour and a half wait so went to get a drink at the bar.  We waited 15 minutes for the bartender to even look at us, and she was very curt with us.  Meanwhile, there were literally half a dozen or more open tables , and while it was a busy Saturday night, it wasn't so busy that we had to be ignored.  When we got seats at the bar, it took almost a full hour to get our food and we were never asked if we wanted water or another glass of wine.  This photo captures the decor which was the icing on the cake. We won't be back but do hope they figure out how to strengthen their customer service because the food was good!

owner_response.author: Nadim K, Owner at Nadim’s Downtown Mediterranean Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for joining us on Saturday night, and although I'm pleased you enjoyed your meal, I'm quite sorry we fell short on the service.

I'm afraid I stretched myself a little thin last weekend. Due to the Jazz festival and a large wedding banquet we catered off-site, the majority of our staff were out of the restaurant. I decided to not fill the tables so that the kitchen crew and few remaining servers would not be overwhelmed. I can see now that we just didn't have the manpower to run as efficiently as I would have liked. I do apologize for your long wait, and I would love for you to call or email me so that I can personally invite you back for another shot! 

Hope to hear from you,

Chef Nadim
nadim@nadims.com
(413) 737-7373

data.title: Always friendly service, delicious fresh food, and timeliness of service helps with short lunch breaks
data.text: A visit to Nadim's is always one I look forward to. The servers are friendly and knowledgeable of their menu. The menu has numerous creative appetizers and wonderful entrees. It's hard not to order the fresh fish- Swai with artichokes, with Nadim's special rice that includes lentils and carmelized onions. For apps- Baba ganoosh,  hummachos with chips, and the fried cauliflower are incredible- but my favorite are the stuffed grape leaves served hot. There is so much more- Enjoy!

owner_response.text:

All the best,
Chef Nadim

data.title: The reviews sold me, and they were so right!
data.text: I proposed this restaurant to my NH And VT nonprofit colleagues and it was a great choice.  The first thing I noticed was how classy the atmosphere was.  We all chose different items for their mini- feast to share family style (it doesn't have to be the chef's choice).  It was not mini!  Our server explained everything and was extremely attentive.   Six of us shared three kinds of meats, Lebanese salad, Mediterranean pita type nachos, spinach pie, and a couple other dishes.  The flavors were so fresh, flavorful, and it was more than we could possibly eat.  It is a great value.  Even for those who aren't big on this type of cuisine, they had a great variety to appeal to all tastes.  I will definitely return when I am in the area!

data.title: Disappointing Middle Eastern Food
data.text: My wife and I love middle eastern food and we were looking forward to our dinner at Nadim's. We were disappointed. The service was OK. The atmosphere was more sports bar than anything else. And, the food, for the most part was mediocre. The best thing  we had was the creamy lentil soup, which was thick and nicely flavored. We shared several appetizers, all of which were awful. For example, stuffed grape leaves, which is a staple, was mushy and so over-salted to be almost inedible. The pita was stale. Not a place that I would go back to!

data.title: Great food, great service, good selections, fun atmosphere
data.text: After a full day, we were in the mood for something different. Nadim's was highly recommended to us. A bonus is that it is located in downtown Springfield, a short walk from the Sheraton, where we were staying. Perfect. On arrival, we were warmly greeted and seated promptly. Decor is quasi funky, but fun. The menu features a variety of unique dishes. The wine list is limited, but gets the job done. All offerings are very reasonably priced. Our waitress was outstanding. She obviously thoroughly enjoys working at Nadim's. She guided us through the menu and made excellent recommendations such that our meals were complementary in a way that afforded us a full sampling of the range of foods offered. Everything was excellent, from the fried cauliflower appetizer to dessert. I look forward to revisiting Nadim's when we return to Springfield.

owner_response.text:

Come back and stop by the next time you're in Springfield -- we'd love to see you again for round two!

All the best,

data.title: A nice place in Springfield for a business lunch
data.text: This place is loved by some but I can't say love is the word for me. The food is good- sometimes better than others- but it is convenient for downtown business lunches if you work in the adjacent office towers in Springfield. The menu for lunch is somewhat limited and the portions are average. I do like their salads very much and their kebabs are tasty. Expect to pay quite a bit more than you may be used to in Springfield for your meal, however. On this last lunch visit, two salads with shrimp and an order of grape leaves was $42 before tip. (No drinks- just water). The pita bread they serve is cold, flat and tasteless. One would think a Lebanese restaurant would serve a bit better pita. Overall, our meal  tasted good but was expensive. It's always full and the take-out is bustling so I know that others really like this place for lunch. Service was very good. Put it this way, I would not drive in from the suburbs to eat dinner here in the evening. Wish I could rate it higher. (P.S. It's typically very cold in the restaurant, especially if you sit in the front where the windows are. Bring a sweater or jacket).

owner_response.author: Nadim K, Owner at Nadim’s Downtown Mediterranean Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for the feedback -- it's disappointing that you haven't been totally impressed with the food! I appreciate your input, and hope that we can give you a better experience the next time you visit!

All the best, 
Chef Nadim

data.title: First letdown
data.text:
This was fourth visit to Nadim's since discovering the place during the women's basketball Final Four in 2005.  We had been there for both lunch and for supper.
  On March 3, we went for supper, and it was our first disappointment.
  It was far too noisy.  We couldn't hear each other talk for all the noise, especially from the bar, which was about 15 feet away.  The couple next to us complained to a server that they couldn't hear their child talk for all the noise.  The place is always noisy, and the owners appear to have chosen the visibility of bare windows and shiny floor to the sound absorption of curtains and carpets, but this time it was much worse.  Bad enough that it detracted from our experience.
  We both ordered lamb.  My wife asked me to taste her kebab because she thought she had been given beef instead.  I agreed.  The server assured us we had both received lamb.  She said she could tell from the skewer on the kebabs.  My lamb steak, like my wife's kebab, had no distinctive flavor of lamb.  It was just another piece of red meat.  Many Americans don't like lamb, but those of us who do and who order it want it to taste like lamb.  I expect the lamb Nadim's is using comes from feedlot lambs rather than pasture-grown lambs.  Put any critter on a feedlot and feed it corn and it will taste like feedlot beef.  Grass-fed lamb's taste is much more distinctive.  And flavorful.  
  All the side dishes were excellent.
  We will no doubt stop at Nadim's again, if we are in Springfield at lunch time.  But at supper, it is just too noisy.  And, we will be more selective in what we order and avoid lamb, although richly flavored lamb is a major reason to eat at a Mediterranean restaurant.  
  Bob Neal
  New Sharon, Maine

owner_response.author: Nadim K, Owner at Nadim’s Downtown Mediterranean Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Lamb is definitely a reason people go to a Mediterranean restaurant, Bob, I won't argue you with you there. The fact that yours didn't' have the distinct lamb flavor disappoints me. I can assure you, I order in only the best meats. I wish that would've been more apparent to you. 

As for the noise, I do appreciate you providing me with that feedback and can definitely look into ways to minimize distractions during busy times. 

I am glad you'll be back to dine with us, again. I hope your experiences only improve from here on out. We'll be sure to do our part to make that happen. 

See you next time, 
Chef Nadim
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Downtown Dining
data.text:
Nadim's is perfectly located for dinner before attending a downtown activity. We easily found safe on-street parking but could have used the on-site parking attendants (we didn't know they were available).

We were seated purposely so that the child with us had full view not only of the basketball game on TV but the engaging fish tank as well.  Smart hostess.  At first I thought this would not be a great place for younger children.  I was dead wrong.  He LOVED the chicken wings.  He devoured the chicken fingers and French fries and finished a bowl of Nadim's famous lentil soup.  To polish everything off, he ended with a gelato.  His belly was full and he was one happy boy.  

My husband and I enjoyed the mid-eastern offerings for which Nadim's is known. My husband had the kifte served with rice pilaf while I had a chicken dish with rice pilaf.  Both were tasty and filling.

We highly recommend Nadim's and will soon return even if we don't have an activity downtown.

owner_response.author: Nadim K, Owner at Nadim’s Downtown Mediterranean Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
That was really smart of the hostess to place the little guy perfectly. I have to say, our team does a great job of making sure each guest/party has the best experience possible, and I'm thankful for them. I'm also thankful you all enjoyed your meals and look forward to coming back! I, too, can't wait to serve you again!

See you then, 
Chef Nadim
